questions.question: Two spinners with colors: red, blue, and green are spun. Which of the following represents the correct structure of a two-way table for all possible outcomes?
A game consists of spinning a spinner and rolling a die. Write the value of X, Y and Z in its 2 way table.
What is the total number of outcomes when a coin is tossed twice?
A die is rolled and a spinner with 4 colors (Red, Blue, Green, Yellow) is spun. Which of the following is in the sample space?
Two different 3-color spinners (Red, Blue, Yellow) are spun. What is the size of the sample space?
A coin is tossed and a 4-color spinner (R, G, B, Y) is spun. What is the sample space?

options.text: {RH, RT, GH, GT, BH, BT, YH, YT}

questions.question: A bag has marbles numbered 1 to 4. You draw one marble and spin a 3-color spinner. How many total outcomes are possible?
You select one letter from {A, B} and roll a standard die. Is "B-2" a possible outcome?
You pick a dessert from {Cake, Ice cream, Pie} and a drink from {Juice, Milk}. Is "Cake-Water" a possible outcome?
You spin a spinner with colors {Red, Blue, Green} and toss a coin (Head, Tail). Is "Green-Tail" a possible outcome?
